ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a great deal about Nahuatl codices, about book traditions, and about ways of structuring and communicating knowledge.
Understanding of manuscript production in colonial Mexico, emphasis on materiality.

This course was an excellent introduction to the sixteenth-Mexican books and varied scholarly approaches to their content. I particularly enjoyed our discussions regarding the material aspects of the books.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Barbara's emphasis on both abstract theoretical and more concrete interpretive and historical texts gave us a good groundwork for discussion that could operate both on specific and more general levels, while her use of facsimiles and trips to see original objects opened out opportunities to understand the materials themselves more clearly and fully. Her ability to lead discussion in productive ways and to accomodate various levels of knowledge among her students without doing either the most knowledgeable nor the least a disservice is incredible.
Strengths: good reading list, hands on learning experiences Weaknesses: focused primarily on Mexico, would have enjoyed learning more about manuscripts in other parts of the Americas

The course was excellent in all aspects. Discussions were deftly guided, assignments were reasonable and helpful for understanding the material, readings were interesting, and our class trips enriched the class work. Feedback was extensive and really beneficial for my writing and considering further paths of inquiry.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. It was an absolute joy, and an opportunity both to learn a great deal about a fascinating visual tradition and to learn more generalizable things about communication and visuality.
Yes, enjoyable classroom discussions & hands on learning.
Absolutely, although I believe that coming into the course with no knowledge of pre-Hispanic or colonial Mexico would be challenging.
